page.title: 01THE COMMON RIDING (1514)
page.content: THE GRID REFERENCE OF TE LAND WE ARE COVERINGIS 03520615.THE MAJOR LAND USE IS FARMING WITH SOME FORESTRY.THE LANDSTRUCTURE ITSELF IS MANLY HILLY.THE RIVER TEVIOT RUNS THROUGH THE AREA AND TROWMILL JOINS THE TEVIOT BELLOW HORNSHOLE BRIDGE. THERE ARE QUITE A FEW HISTORIC SIGHTS IN THE AREA HORNSHOLE AND CAVERS CHURCH.AT TROW MILL THERE IS A TWEED FACTORY.FURTHER DOWN STREAM THERE IS THE PLACE WHERE SOME SOLDIERS IN HAWICK GARDING HORNSHOLE FROM THE ENGLISH SPOTTED AN ENGLISH GROUPE OF SOLDIERS SO THEY ATTACT THEM AND STOLE THERE FLAG AND RODE INTO HAWICK WITH IT.EVER SINCE THEN (YEAR 1514 AFTER THE BATTLE OF FLOODEN)A FLAG LIKE IT HAS BEEN CARRIED EVERY YEAR ABOUT HAWICK AND SOMEONE IS PICKED TO CARRIE IT BUT ONLY IN JUNE THIS IS CALLED THE COMMON RIDING
